text: I think rubyan reals absolutely lowers
the bar uh in terms of what it takes to
to get a web application going um some
people see that as a negative thing like
Oh The Barbarians are at the gate we got
all these unwashed masses flowing into
our beautiful pristine programming
communities um and we heard this a lot
of times before uh Visual Basic before
that was chastized for for bringing in
sort of unpure programmers I think it's
um there is no such thing as as
the pure programmer and I think that
what's Magic about the rubyan rails
Community is exactly that it attracts
people from from all different camps
that it attracts people who are not
primarily programmers uh I find that
often the best ideas come from people
who are not programmers people who bring
just a entirely different perspective on
things um in fact uh being a newbie is
such a
important stage um because that's where
you question everything when I first
came to to Ruby I questioned everything
it was like why doesn't this thing exist
why is this hard um that's stupid like
we should change that you have this sort
of initial naive approach to things that
makes it impossible for you to see what
should be impossible you just
do um if I had known in the beginning
how much work it would have been to
actually create rails I probably would
never have started I started because I
just found one little thing that to my
naive newb sense um seemed easy to do so
I think it's really important that we
keep this flow of new people New Blood
fresh blood coming into the community
and I also think it's wonderful that
we're creating a larger group of people
who can create applications
um trying to have protectionism is is
never a good idea uh trying to sort of
set up like this should only be these um
carefully trained programmers who are
able to make programs B that's not how
it should be we should absolutely have
programmers of all kinds um some of
these programmers will be new and they
won't know everything and they'll create
shitty programs but you know what most
of the time a shitty program solves the
problem you don't need perfect programs
all the time uh there are so many
problems in the world
that the tiny group of
pristine um white night programmers just
can't solve like they can't solve all of
them there's just not enough of them so
we need programmers of all uh all levels
to to solve the programming problems of
the
world so for me it's really there's two
angles to this there is we can
absolutely make things simple simpler I
think I made a lot of web development a
lot simpler with rails but there's a
natural physical limit where at the end
programming is just choices how should
the program work what should happen when
you click this button those choices are
ultimately what's the key of programming
and you can't get out of that which is
also why I think that sometimes it's a
little bit of a a pipe dream to think
that oh there's going to be these
magical environments where somebody who
knows nothing about programming will
just be able to drag and drop a few
things into a box and then voila you
will have the most amazing program in
the world no it's really not going to
happen like that because to have the
most amazing programmer in the world you
need to care about a thousand decisions
and recording those thousand decisions
takes a programming language so there is
a lower limit to how simple it can get
and that lower limit is do you care
about these decisions once you
um all the decisions you care about have
to be codified somehow and I don't know
of any more effective way of doing that
than than with a great programming
language so I'm not a big believer that
uh at some point uh we're all going to
create these uh wonderful applications
there'll be a class of applications
where you design a niche and say okay if
I have to just slightly tailor some
accounting software yeah there can be
something simpler for that but if you
want want a freedom of expression to
create any type of web application say
you need a tool that's expressive enough
to to enable that and that is a
programming language it doesn't get any
simpler than
that
